metadata.name: toast
metadata.description: A function to create and manage toast notifications. It provides a simple API to show, update, and dismiss toast messages in the application.
metadata.signature: function toast(props: Toast): { id: string; dismiss: () => void; update: (props: ToasterToast) => void }

title.description: The title of the toast notification

description.description: The description/content of the toast notification

action.description: Optional action element to be displayed in the toast

id.description: Unique identifier for the created toast

dismiss.description: Function to dismiss this specific toast

update.description: Function to update the content of this toast

examples: toast({ title: 'Success', description: 'Your changes have been saved' })

metadata.name: useToast
metadata.description: A custom React hook that provides toast notification functionality. It manages a global toast state and provides methods to create, update, and dismiss toast notifications.
metadata.signature: function useToast(): { toasts: ToasterToast[]; toast: (props: Toast) => { id: string; dismiss: () => void; update: (props: ToasterToast) => void }; dismiss: (toastId?: string) => void }
metadata.implementationNotes: The hook uses a global state management approach with a reducer pattern. It maintains a list of active toasts and handles their lifecycle through a subscription system.

toast.description: Function to create new toast notifications
